translation: Dhāraṇī of Golden Light
Thus I have heard.

source_sentence: 一時薄伽梵住如籬[竺-二+冉]。
translation: One time, the Bhagavān was staying at Ruṣi [Zhu-ji+ran].
He was with Yakṣa ... Vajrapāṇi.
At the time, the hundred gods gave alms and went to the Bhagavān.
When they arrived, they bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet.
After retreating, he sat to one side.
The goddess Bhaiṣajyaguru said to the Buddha.
"Bhagavān!
"When I entered the battlefield and fought, I fell into a negative place because of an asura's illusory spell and medicine.

source_sentence: 以阿修羅幻惑呪術藥力墮於負處□已不。
translation: Have I fallen into a bad place because of an asura's illusory spell or medicine?
Only so, may it please the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 慈愍於我為令摧伏阿修羅眾幻惑呪術及藥力故。
translation: Have compassion on me, so that I can subdue the illusory, deluded spells and medicinal powers of the asuras.
He'll skillfully recite the most excellent and mysterious spell.

source_sentence: 時薄伽梵告天帝百施曰。
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed the god Tippaliputra, saying.
"Thus and so, Kauśika.
When he fought with the asuras, they really used a spell, a mystical spell, and the power of medicine.

source_sentence: 實以明呪祕呪藥力而墮負處。
translation: He really falls into a bad position because of the power of a bright spell, a mysterious spell, and medicine.
Kauśika.
Now, for pity's sake, I'll explain the spell.

source_sentence: 欲令幻惑時呪退散鬪戰諍訟悉皆消滅。
translation: I want to cause illusory mental disturbances to subside when the spell is withdrawn, and all quarrels and arguments to cease.

source_sentence: 一切祕呪及諸藥等而得斷除。
translation: All secret spells, medicines, and so forth will be stopped.
He explained the incantation in a clear manner.

source_sentence: 爾時薄伽梵說大金有明呪曰。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke the great golden-hued incantation, saying.
"Now, I'll preach this dhāraṇī for three incalculable eons.

source_sentence: 諸餘外道行者遍遊罣形。
translation: The rest of the non-Buddhist practitioners travel around in force and form.
They give rise to bad thoughts and create obstacles.

source_sentence: 我從彼來所有幻惑一切明呪悉能降伏。
translation: Since then, I've been able to subdue all illusory mental disturbances with this incantation.
The six perfections are fulfilled.

source_sentence: 斷除諸餘外道行者遍遊罣形諸惱亂。
translation: They ended the rest of the non-Buddhist practitioners who wander about in convulsions and forms and cause disruptions.

source_sentence: 因明呪祕呪藥及一切諸魔朋黨大明之呪。
translation: It's a great incantation of insight, a secret spell, a medicine, and a great incantation of insight for all the demons and their friends.
Kauśika.

source_sentence: 汝當攝受諸有情故受持最勝大祕密呪。
translation: 'You will take in sentient beings and thus maintain the most excellent great esoteric spell.'
The god Ti said.
"So it is, Bhagavān!
'Please accept the teaching.'
It was then that the Bhagavān addressed them.
He then spoke the great golden-hued dhāraṇī, saying.

source_sentence: 怛也他唵　希儞希儞　希離希離　命離命離　希明離　儞希儞希　儞希囉祕儞　乾佐那波羝　哺羝哆滿怛囉　阿地訖梨羝　閉羝閉羝　閉哆滿怛囉　阿地迦囉羝　訶那訶那　訶婆訶婆　親駄親駄　頻那頻那　薄伽跋羝　佐曳祕佐曳　攢婆儞悉談婆儞　畔駄儞　牟訶儞　阿牟伽爍羝　馱囉儞　訖利那訖梨那　迦多[木*奈]磨那婆　攢婆也攢婆也　畔佐也畔佐也　悉談婆也　悉噉婆也　畔馱也畔馱也　牟訶也牟訶也所有一切。
translation: 怛也他唵　希儞希儞　希離希離　命離命離　希明離　儞希儞希　儞希囉祕儞　乾佐那波羝　哺羝哆滿怛囉　阿地訖梨羝　閉羝閉羝　閉哆滿怛囉　阿地迦囉羝　訶那訶那　訶婆訶婆　親駄親駄　頻那頻那　薄伽跋羝　佐曳祕佐曳　攢婆儞悉談婆儞　畔駄儞　牟訶儞　阿牟伽爍羝　馱囉儞　訖利那訖梨那　迦多[木*奈]磨那婆　攢婆也攢婆也　畔佐也畔佐也　悉談婆也　悉噉婆也　畔馱也畔馱也　牟訶也牟訶也所有一切。
Whether it's the illusory afflictions of gods or dragons ...
Whether it's the illusory afflictions of dragons ...

...and Rāṣṭrapāla's illusory afflictions.
...and the illusory afflictions of the Kinnaras ...
...if it's the illusion of the gandharvas ...
...if it's the delusion of an asura ...
...if it's the illusion of Māluṅkyaputta ...

If it's a delusion of the accomplished king who holds a bright spell ...
Whether it's the illusion of sages or the illusion of dhāraṇīs.
Whether it's a mirage of holding a spell of great insight or a mirage of holding a spell of great insight.
Whether it's the illusion of a multitude of beings ...
Whether it's an illusion or a delusion of all illusions...

source_sentence: 囉羅囉羅囉佐也囉佐也　妬磨覩磨　妬妬磨　囉婆囉婆　囉婆那　作割蘭單　伽蘭他儞　訶那訶那　薩婆鞞哆　奢咄嚧難　悉談婆也　秀延悉談婆也　蘇南悉談婆也　婆嚧難悉談婆也　惡儞寅悉談婆也　欝乾　哆梨哆梨　梨馱　囉羝惟　馱囉寧　波奢訶悉羝　弊奢他也婆世那　若有於我能為怨敵諸賊嗔恚具惡心鬪諍極諍欲作一切無利益者　訶那訶那　哆訶哆訶　波佐波佐　半佐也半佐也　攢婆也攢婆也　悉談婆也悉談婆也　半馱也半馱也　牟訶也牟訶也　摩訶牟訶儞　薄伽跋羝[卄/娑]訶　於一切怖畏嬈惱疾疫願守護我叺馱[卄/娑]訶憍尸迦。
translation: 囉羅囉羅囉佐也囉佐也　妬磨覩磨　妬妬磨　囉婆囉婆　囉婆那　作割蘭單　伽蘭他儞　訶那訶那　薩婆鞞哆　奢咄嚧難　悉談婆也　秀延悉談婆也　蘇南悉談婆也　婆嚧難悉談婆也　惡儞寅悉談婆也　欝乾　哆梨哆梨　梨馱　囉羝惟　馱囉寧　波奢訶悉羝　弊奢他也婆世那　若有於我能為怨敵諸賊嗔恚具惡心鬪諍極諍欲作一切無利益者　訶那訶那　哆訶哆訶　波佐波佐　半佐也半佐也　攢婆也攢婆也　悉談婆也悉談婆也　半馱也半馱也　牟訶也牟訶也　摩訶牟訶儞　薄伽跋羝[卄/娑]訶　於一切怖畏嬈惱疾疫願守護我叺馱[卄/娑]訶憍尸迦。

source_sentence: 於彼部黨他所敵軍不能侵惱。
translation: He's not a member of his party or an enemy army that can harm him.
They are not gods or dragons, and they are not yakṣas or gandharvas.
It's not Yakṣa, and it's not a gandharva.

Nor is he a mahoraga.
Nor is it a luminous dhāraṇī holder.

source_sentence: 亦不非時而持壽命明呪祕呪一切諸藥不能為害。
translation: Nor does he hold a life-span spell or a secret spell at an inappropriate time, for which all medicines cannot harm him.
They can't be overcome by an enemy army.
An army of enemies from another place won't harm their lives.
A sword can't harm them.

source_sentence: 水火毒藥明呪祕呪一切諸藥而不能侵。
translation: A bright spell for water and fire poisons, a secret spell, and all medicines can't harm him.

source_sentence: 還著於彼自作教隨喜造罪彼之處所。
translation: They're still attached to their own teachings, and they delight in creating crimes where they are.
Kauśika.

"Upāsaka Upāsikā.

It'll wash your own body and protect it.

source_sentence: 若有欲令於一切怖畏一切嬈惱一切疫疾一切明呪一切祕呪一切諸藥一切厭蠱而超過者。
translation: If there's anyone who wants to cause all fears, all agitation, all epidemics, all bright spells, all secret spells, all medicines, and all disgusting compulsions to pass away, then they should remember this gold mantra.
He should remember that this gold has a bright spell.
Suppose a king or a minister of a king.

source_sentence: 若欲摧他軍眾伏他軍眾。
translation: If he wants to destroy a multitude of other armies and subdue a multitude of other armies, he should also recite this gold, brilliant spell.
He should also recite this gold mantra with insight.

source_sentence: 若呪線七遍作七結已繫於身上。
translation: If you curse a thread seven times and tie it to your body in seven knots, then you should recite this gold-bright mantra.
If you were to recite the spell seven times over with water, it would protect you.

source_sentence: 若有書寫於一切怖畏無障礙陀羅尼。
translation: If there's a written dhāraṇī that's free of obstructions to all fears, perhaps it can be accepted or upheld.
Perhaps it can be accepted and upheld.

source_sentence: 或繫脛下若置高幢入軍陣者。
translation: It might be tied under his shin or placed on a high banner and entered an army formation.
They'll be well-settled and able to escape.
Because of the authoritative power of this golden dhāraṇī, his inner circle and retinue will be well-settled.
His inner circle and retinue will entrust him with good fortune and tranquility.
It's not yet complete, but it can be completed.
If he wants to subdue the spells of knowledge, he should place a spell on a white thread seven times and then do so seven times.

source_sentence: 於白線上呪七遍已作七結者。
translation: He puts a spell on a white thread seven times and then forms seven bonds.
He'll be able to bind them and subdue them.
If he wants to destroy illusory mental disturbances, he'll take a spell made of dirt on a tomb seven times and scatter it.

source_sentence: 取塚間土呪七遍已而散擲者。
translation: He takes a spell made from the earth between the graves seven times and tosses it away.

source_sentence: 取秦萩蘺呪七遍已而嚙嚼者。
translation: Take a spell made from a wild goose that's been curried seven times and chew it.
He'll be able to respond to all comments.

source_sentence: 却往於彼造作之者及思惟所。

source_sentence: 一切明呪祕呪諸藥不能為害。

source_sentence: 天帝百施聞佛所說信受奉行。
translation: The god Ti Bai Shi heard what the Buddha taught and faithfully accepted and approved of it.
